Improvements.Improvement: Use try-with-resources to manage Robot resources
Improvements.Change_Diff:
- Robot screenshooter=new Robot(screens[screen]);
+ try (Robot screenshooter = new Robot(screens[screen])) {
Improvements.Description: The try-with-resources statement is a try statement that declares one or more resources. A resource is an object that must be closed after the program is finished with it. The try-with-resources statement ensures that each resource is closed at the end of the statement. You can use a try-with-resources statement in the place of Robot class to improve code readability and resource management.
Instead of using traditional for loop to iterate over `screens`, use `Arrays.stream` to make code more readable and less error-prone.

Improvements.Improvement: Use `StandardCharsets` instead of string for encoding
Improvements.Description: Using `StandardCharsets` instead of string for encoding names is less error-prone and more readable. Replace 'MAC' with `StandardCharsets.MAC`.
